alert.note: Alert for Sierra (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 6:01PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is likely occurring. * WHERE...A portion of south central New Mexico, including the following county, Sierra. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 600 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This replaces the flash flood warning. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hillsboro, Emory Pass and Kingston. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
